ca.ualberta.cmput301w14t08.geochan.fragments
Class MapViewFragment

java.lang.Object
  android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      ca.ualberta.cmput301w14t08.geochan.fragments.MapViewFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener
public class MapViewFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment

A Fragment class for displaying Maps. The Map will display the locations of each comment in the thread, and will center around the original post. It will provide the feature of getting directions from the users current location to the location of the original post.

Author:
Brad Simons

onStart

public void onStart()
Initiates a location listener which immediately starts listening for location updates. Gets the current location as well. Then unpacks the bundle passed to the fragment. It then gets the map setup and prepares the min and max latitude and longitude required to display the map properly for calculation. Then finally sets the zoom level

Overrides:
onStart in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

onStop

public void onStop()
Calls onStop in the superclass, and tells the locationListener to stop listening.

Overrides:
onStop in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

setupClusterGroups

public void setupClusterGroups()
Sets up cluster groups so that when many Markers over lap each other in the same cluster group, a cluster image is displayed instead of the markers. This cluster image also displays the number of Markers that it represents

setupMap

public void setupMap(Comment topComment)
This sets up the comment location the map. The map is centered at the location of the comment GeoLocation, and places a pin at this point. It then calls handleChildComments to place pins for each child comment in the thread.

Parameters:
topComment - The OP of the ThreadComment.

setZoomLevel

public void setZoomLevel(GeoLocation geoLocation)
Sets the default zoom level for the mapview. This takes the max and min of both lat and long, and zooms to span the area required. It also animates to the startGeoPoint, which is the location of the topComment. The values must be padded with a zoom_factor, which is a static class variable

Parameters:
geoLocation - GeoLocation used to start the basis of the distance

commentLocationIsValid

public boolean commentLocationIsValid(Comment comment)
Checks to see if a comment in the thread has valid GPS coordinates. Valid coordinates are -90 < lat < 90, and -180 < longitude < 180. It also does a null check on location.

Parameters:
comment - to be check for valid location
Returns:
boolean isValidLocation

getDirections

public void getDirections()
Called when the get_directions_button is clicked. Displays directions from the users current location to the comment location. Uses an Async task to get map overlay. If the users current location cannot be obtained, an error is shown to the screen and the async task is not called
